indicators.justification:
Swedish data over endangered species is updated every 5 years by SLU and the Swedish Environmental Protection Agency in the form of a written report. (1) This data is also available in an application (2), where users can search for species, compare with historical data from the year 2000 and make bulk downloads. Users can contribute and report species, where they saw it, and when. The information will be displayed openly and be searchable.

indicators.justification:
The Swedish Companies Registration Office is responsible for keeping a register over beneficial ownership, covering the whole economy. In 2015, the European Parliament adopted a new money laundering directive. According to the directive, all EU countries must have a register of real owners.(1) On the authorities' website there is information about this register and what it includes (2). When logged in, the user is presented with the terms of use, and when accepted can search for beneficial ownership information. It's only possible to access individual records in the register, with The Swedish Companies Registration Office API's over company information, users can buy data in XML-format. (3)

1 EUROPAPARLAMENTETS OCH RÅDETS DIREKTIV (EU) 2015/849 av den 20 maj 2015 om åtgärder för att förhindra att det finansiella systemet används för penningtvätt eller finansiering av terrorism, om ändring av Europaparlamentets och rådets förordning (EU) nr 648/2012 och om upphävande av Europaparlamentets och rådets direktiv 2005/60/EG och kommissionens direktiv 2006/70/EG, Europeiska unionens officiella tidning, L 141/73, 2015 https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/SV/TXT/?uri=CELEX:32015L0849 

2 The Swedish Companies Registration Office, Sök verklig huvudman https://bolagsverket.se/om/oss/fler/verklig-huvudman/verklig-huvudman-1.13878  

3 The Swedish Companies Registration Office, API på Bolagsverket https://bolagsverket.se/om/oss/api-pa-bolagsverket

indicators.justification:
Sweden's open data regarding civil registration and vital statistics can be found at multiple places. On Statistics Sweden's website e.g births and deaths by sex and country of birth 1970–2020 and projection 2021–2070,(1) life expectancy and causes of death (2) and population statistics. (3) The National Board of Health and Welfare hosts data about pregnancies, births, and newborns. (4). The population registration database should contain information about mothers and fathers, birth information of place of birth that the other open data regarding civil registration and vital statistics stated does not include. (5)

(1)Statistics Sweden, 2020, Births and deaths by sex and country of birth 1970–2020 and projection 2021–2070, https://www.scb.se/hitta-statistik/statistik-efter-amne/befolkning/befolkningsframskrivningar/befolkningsframskrivningar/pong/tabell-och-diagram/fodda-och-doda-efter-kon-och-fodelseland-samt-framskrivning/


(2)Statistics Sweden, 2019, Life expectancy and causes of death, https://www.scb.se/hitta-statistik/temaomraden/jamstalldhet/jamstalld-halsa/livslangd-och-dodsorsaker/?showAllContentLinks=True#129967

(3) Statistics Sweden, 2021, Population statistics
https://www.scb.se/en/finding-statistics/statistics-by-subject-area/population/population-composition/population-statistics/


(4) The National Board of Health and Welfare, 2020, Statistics on pregnancies, births and newborns,
https://www.socialstyrelsen.se/statistik-och-data/statistik/statistikamnen/graviditeter-forlossningar-och-nyfodda/

(5) The Swedish Tax Agency, The population registration database, https://www.skatteverket.se/privat/folkbokforing/attvarafolkbokford/folkbokforingsdatabasen.4.3810a01c150939e893f16fe2.html

indicators.justification:
The current legislation does not include a comprehensive framework for generating and publishing open data, but focuses on the use and re-use of documents. It facilitates the use by individuals of documents provided by public authorities. (1)

Following the revision of the latest open data directive from the EU in 2019,(2) the Swedish government task has been to propose how the open data directive should be implemented in Swedish law and how the authorities will work to make open data and information available and also receive better legal support.(3)

indicators.justification:
Law 2016: 1091 on budget and financial administration for the government authorities (1) does not cover the budget reports to be published as open data. In article 9, section 1 §, the authorities are obliged to report to the government over the assets that the authority manages and disposes of. The accounting obligation also includes the authority's debts and other financial commitments. 

In the Budget Law, article 10, section 1 § (2) the Government is accountable to the parliament for the assets that the Government manages and has at its disposal. There is no mention of this data to be published as open data.

indicators.justification:
Open Up!'(3) is a project by Open Knowledge Sweden and DIGG that supports public authorities to publish open data about their purchases and for other actors to reuse them.

There are 14 authorities, 5 municipalities, and 1 region who has published accounts payable data on the platform (4) and therefore are a pilot project or an isolated use of procurement data.


Opentender.eu (5) is a project run by Digiwhist and the platform makes public tenders more transparent. There is a total of 110 468 tenders in this dashboard from the year 2009-2020 in Sweden, but is not covering all tenders. According to statistics from The National Agency for Public Procurement (6), there are 150 602 total tenders from 2012-2019.

There are private actors that provide services for analyzing procurement data, for example, Decimalen.se (5), but it is not public what public authorities use these services, or evidence of the effects.
